answers.answer: HiThanks for writing to the forum!The symptoms point more towards an endocrine pathology. You must seriously consider diabetes insipidus and diabetes mellitus. You would need a comprehensive investigation to diagnose these. A urine test should anyway be done to rule out UTI.I think you should discuss these possibilities with your doctor. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: HiI'm a 39 yr old woman.  Recently I've started to get a strange feeling in my lower abdomen soon after urinating followed by pins and needles in both my palms.And almost immediately I feel I have to urinate again and I do, just a lillte and this happens 3 to 4 times.  Then I feel fine for a few hours and the whole process repeats when I have to urinate again.I know my body and am worried as I'v never experienced anything like this.  Please advise.
title: Pins and needles in palms soon after urinating.
